Module videoPoker
Package playingCards

Class Card

java.lang.Object
playingCards.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Card>
public class Card extends Object implements Comparable<Card>
This class implements a regular playing card with face and suit values.

It implements the Comparable interface in order to compare cards by their face value.

Two extra suit values are also provided, Any and Some, to provide functionality when comparing the equality of cards.

Author:
Bernardo Silva, Miguel Madeira, Vicente Silvestre

  • Constructor Details

    • Card

      public Card(int face, int suit)
      Constructs a card from values given as integers.

      The face value should be the corresponding number for numbered cards and 11 for Jacks, 12 for Queens, 13 for Kings and 14 for aces.

      The suit value should be in the correspondence: 0 = Clubs, 1 = Spades, 2 = Hearts, 3 = Diamonds, 4 = Any, 5 = Some

      Parameters:
      face - Card's face value
      suit - Card's suit value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the face or the suit values are invalid.

    • Card

      public Card(String card)
      Constructs a Card from a string with at most two characters.

      A card face can be represented by a number from 2 to 9 or T (ten), J (Jack), Q (Queen), K (King), A (Ace).

      A card suit can be represented by the initial of the suit (C, S, H or D), or by an "X" corresponding to the Some suit or a "*" corresponding to the Any suit. In case of omission, the suit is considered to be Any.

      Parameters:
      string - representation of a card with at most 2 characters

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks whether two cards have equal face and compares the suit.

      Two cards are equal whenever they have the same face and the same suit, or when they have the same face and at least one of them has suit Some or Any.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Returns:
      logic value of euqality
